New Records: Hardik Pandya scored an unbeaten 39 off 16 balls.
Arshdeep Singh took 3 wickets and was named Player of the Match.
Mayank Yadav made his debut and performed well.
Varun Chakravarthy returned to the India team and took 3 wickets.
Key Match Events: Hardik Pandya hit a six to finish the match with 7 wickets in hand.
Arshdeep Singh bowled an excellent spell with 2 wickets.
Suryakumar Yadav and Sanju Samson contributed with 29 and 24 runs respectively.
Bangladesh's batting collapse and poor shot selection led to their loss.
Pre-Game Insights: India elected to bowl first after winning the toss.
Bangladesh's captain Najmul Hossain Shanto hoped for a strong start from his batters.
India's captain Suryakumar Yadav highlighted the team's readiness and the importance of adapting to conditions.
Post-Match Reflections: Suryakumar Yadav praised the team's character and selflessness.
Najmul Hossain Shanto acknowledged Bangladesh's poor performance and called for better strike rotation.
Arshdeep Singh expressed happiness with his bowling performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in Gwalior, and the crowd supported India.
The wicket-keeper Sanju Samson had a decent performance but failed to convert his start.
Others: The match was the first of a three-match series.
